title: Formulando la pregunta de investigación
description: En este post describo mi tema de interes y las variables disponible para este analisis.Esta sera la base de mi investigación para ICP5006.
contents:
Introducción
En la sociedad de hoy nos encontramos con un fenómeno interesante
c


df_lapop_chile <- readRDS("output/lapop_chile_220824.rds")
df_lapop_int <- readRDS("output/lapop_int_220824.rds")


Tema de enfoque
Dependiendo de la base de datos disponibles puedo determinar cual mi
enfoque sera. El enfoque principal es en ‘datos politicos’. En este se
interpretan dos opciones: * 1. Socio-economia y confianza en gobierno:
Enfocarse en la dinamica a traves del tiempo entre la percepcion
democratica de Chile y cambios socio-economicos. * 2. Socio-economia y
polucion: Enfocarse en la dinamica a traves del tiempo entre cambios
socio-economicos y la polucion en diferentes partes del ecosistema
(agua, aire)
Para esto he encontrado varios bases de datos:
https://datosretc.mma.gob.cl/organization/retc
https://data.worldbank.org/country/chile
https://www.vanderbilt.edu/lapop/raw-data.php
https://data.humdata.org/dataset/world-bank-environment-indicators-for-chile/resource/2c62322f-3ab9-4a22-af03-f67df894a709
Hipotesis
Mi hipotesis es la siguiente: ‘hipotesis’
Las emiciones son mas altas cuando el desaroyo economico es mas
alto y la urbanizacion incrementa
Las personas confian mas en el gobierno cuando el mercado laboral
y la economia incrementa
Con subhipotesis:




Argumentos para mi hipotesis:
Variables operacionales
Emisiones
Sexo
Edad
Urbanizacion
Agricultura area
Estatus economico individual
Datos laborales (empleo, ingreso)
Energia renovable y acceso a energia renovable
Distill is a publication format for scientific and technical writing,
native to the web.
Learn more about using Distill at https://rstudio.github.io/distill.

title: Welcome to ICP5006 Blog of Farley Rimon
description: Welcome to our new blog, ICP5006 Blog of Farley Rimon. Here you can keep track of the progress made during the course. I will document my     opinion on findings about projects related to urban data analysis.

title: Week 1
description: A short description of the post.
contents:
So far, struggling a little
bit
Things tend to go slow for several reasons:

I just want to get started with the projects!

Program interface (to zoom or not to zoom?)
Disbalance in student expertise
I just want to get started with the projects!Or the hardcore
(new) theory. I believe reviewing old material is to be done in
someone’s own time. Well, that’s how my uni went so I am used to the
stress hahaha. It is also just part of my natural character. Because of
this, I am excited for what is to come…
Finished taller de R
Experience: + Not very different to Python + Need to get used to the
syntax + Actually pretty easy to use. The interface is insanely simple +
I am scared some solutions I will not know because of a lack of
dominance of R. Hopefully we can help each other with
this.
